meanings.definition: To surpass in catching or capturing.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah easily outcatches the gazelle in the race.
meanings.sent2: The skilled fisherman outcatches his competitors every time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outcatches the mischievous raccoon in gathering nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her wit outcatches any opponent in a battle of words.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web outcatches unsuspecting insects with its sticky threads.

meanings.definition: To outdo in catching or capturing.
meanings.sent1: The spider outcatches its prey with precision and speed.
meanings.sent2: The hunter outcatches the elusive deer in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The cat outcatches the mouse in a playful game of chase.
meanings.sent4: His determination outcatches any obstacle in his path to success.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web outcatches any other trap with its clever design.
